c:complexType.name: CartesianChart
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class for the Cartesian charts.

c:property.name: seriesRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The series visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a series of connected data points.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: colorRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: plots
c:property.c:documentation:
An array of cartesian plots.
All the cartesian plots can be used together, from within a cartesian chart class, as long as their axes, notably base and ortho, are encoding compatible visual roles.
See for additional information.

c:property.name: baseAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The base cartesian axis panel options.
When the chart is vertical the base axis is laid out horizontally.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: orthoAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
When the chart is vertical the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: showXScale
c:property.c:documentation:
Use , of the x axis, instead.
Indicates whether the x axis panel is shown.

c:property.name: showYScale
c:property.c:documentation:
Use , of the y axis, instead.
Indicates whether the y axis panel is shown.

c:property.name: plotFrameVisible
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates whether the plot frame is drawn in leaf charts.
The plot frame covers the plot panel but stays aligned with and below the axes' rules.
The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot frame.

c:property.name: leafContentOverflow
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates what is to be done with content that overflows in leaf charts.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the chart.

c:complexType.name: CartesianChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points common to all cartesian chart types.
Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.

c:property.name: plotFrame
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the plot frame of the charts.
The plot frame covers the plot panel(s) but stays aligned with and below the axes' rules.
The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot frame.

c:property.name: plotBg
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the plot area background of cartesian charts.
The plot background is placed below the plot panel(s) and below the axis grid-lines.
This extension point is intended, primarily, to be able to change the background color below multiple plots, without hiding the axes grid-lines.
The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot area background.

c:complexType.name: CartesianPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of cartesian plot types.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation:
The plot's visual roles map.
See for more information.

c:complexType.name: CartesianPlotVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles options class of cartesian plot types.

c:property.name: series
c:property.c:documentation:
The series visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a series of connected data points.
Most cartesian charts represent graphically the connectedness of data points of a given series in some way, by connecting points with a line, by giving them all the same color, or, simply, by the order in which they are drawn, and when overlapped, some stay on top of others.
The series visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the series prefix.
The visual role itself is optional, yet, when unbound, a dimension with a "series" prefix is automatically created for it, and all datums will have the value null in that dimension.
The only cartesian chart type that ignores the series visual role is the Box plot.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
The color visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the color prefix or, if none exists, the dimensions of the "series" role.
The color visual role is discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.
